isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - EVRT® Electronically Controlled Turbocharger - Removal - Variable Geometry Turbocharger (VGT) Assembly and Components

svcproc.title: Variable Geometry Turbocharger (VGT) Assembly and Components

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure that the engine has cooled down sufficiently before attempting to remove VGT assembly.

To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure to disconnect the battery cable from the battery. Failure to remove the battery ground cable could cause an electrical arc while removing the turbocharger.

step1.para: Remove turbo oil inlet tube assembly nut from fitting on top of oil filter header.
Remove two bolts (M8 x 20) from turbo oil inlet tube assembly. Remove tube assembly, and discard O-ring.

figure.caption: Oil drain tube bracket and bolt

step1.para: Remove the bolt (M8 x 16) from the turbo oil drain tube bracket.
Disconnect electrical harness from VGT actuator.

note.para: To aid in the disassembly of the turbocharger, loosen four nuts (M10) between ⅛ and ¼ of a turn then tap each nut using a socket or flat punch and hammer. This will knock the "peaks" of the stud threads off the "ramps" of the special Spiralock® nuts, thus allowing the nuts to unthread with considerable ease.

step1.para: Remove four nuts (M10) securing the VGT assembly to the exhaust manifold.
Remove VGT assembly and turbo oil drain tube as a combined unit. Discard turbo mounting gasket, oil drain tube O-rings, and mounting nuts.
